title.value: Definitive Care for Severely Injured Children in Quebec
title.justification: The title clearly describes the focus of the paper, which is about providing definitive care for severely injured children in Quebec.
title.quote: Definitive Care for Severely Injured Children in Quebec

extractions.description: This paper explores the outcomes of severely injured pediatric trauma patients at the Montreal Children’s Hospital over a ten-year period, examining ICU admission rates, length of hospital stay, and mortality rates among different regional groups in Quebec.

type.justification: The study involves data analysis of patients over a ten-year period and performs regression analysis, indicating empirical research.
type.quote: Methods: Descriptive analysis and multiple logistic regression were performed for severely injured pediatric trauma patients received at the Montreal Children’s Hospital over a ten-year period.

name.justification: The paper is about medical care for severely injured children, fitting within the field of Medical Research.
name.quote: Injury is the leading cause of death in children over the age of one in Canada, and remains the most common cause of death in Quebec pediatric patients.

name.justification: The research is specifically focused on pediatric patients and the surgical intervention involved in trauma care.
name.quote: Harvey E. Beardmore Division of Pediatric Surgery, The Montreal Children’s Hospital, McGill University Health Centre,

name.justification: The paper discusses trauma systems and the care provided to critically injured pediatric patients.
name.quote: The development of trauma systems and regionalization of trauma care has led to a significant improvement in patient outcomes.
